articleContent.title: Chord: Diminished 7th in F (Shape: G)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: Diminished 7th in F (Shape: G)

## Description
The Diminished 7th chord is a dissonant four-note chord comprising a diminished triad with a diminished 7th interval added on top. In the key of F, the Diminished 7th chord built on the note G consists of the notes G-Bb-Db-F. This chord is also known as Gdim7.

## Notes and Intervals (in the key of F)
- Root: G
- Minor 3rd above the root: Bb
- Diminished 5th above the root: Db
- Diminished 7th above the root: F

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Diminished 7th chord is commonly found in jazz and classical music. It adds tension and instability, creating a sense of foreboding or unease in a musical piece. Due to its dissonant nature, it is often used as a passing chord or for chromatic movement in compositions.

## Songs
1. Song: "Blue Monk" by Thelonious Monk
   - This jazz standard prominently features Diminished 7th chords, adding a bluesy and sophisticated flair to the composition.
   
2. Song: "Psycho" by Muse
   - In this rock track, the Diminished 7th chord is used to create a dark and intense atmosphere, enhancing the eerie feeling of the song.

3. Song: "Black Coffee" by Sarah Vaughan
   - This jazz ballad utilizes the Diminished 7th chord to add emotional depth and complexity to the harmonic structure of the piece.
